member.name: T:Intersoft.Client.UI.Controls.OrientedSize
member.summary: The OrientedSize structure is used to abstract the growth direction from the layout algorithms of WrapPanel. When the growth direction is oriented horizontally (ex: the next element is arranged on the side of the previous element), then the Width grows directly with the placement of elements and Height grows indirectly with the size of the largest element in the row. When the orientation is reversed, so is the directional growth with respect to Width and Height.

member.summary: The orientation of the structure.

member.summary: The size dimension that grows directly with layout placement.

member.name: F:Intersoft.Client.UI.Controls.OrientedSize._indirect
member.summary: The size dimension that grows indirectly with the maximum value of the layout row or column.

member.name: T:Intersoft.Client.UI.Controls.Viewbox
member.summary: Defines a content decorator that can stretch and scale a single child to fill the available space.
member.remarks: Viewbox should inherit from Decorator (which inherits from FrameworkElement), but the closest working base in Silverlight is the ContentControl class. This provides a number of extra APIs not present in WPF that should be avoided (including the Template property which should not be changed from its default value). Viewbox has been sealed to prevent the creation of derived classes that depend on these features not available on its WPF counterpart.

member.name: T:Intersoft.Client.UI.Controls.ViewboxInternal
member.summary: Defines a content decorator that can stretch and scale a single child to fill the available space.
member.remarks: Viewbox should inherit from Decorator (which inherits from FrameworkElement), but the closest working base in Silverlight is the ContentControl class. This provides a number of extra APIs not present in WPF that should be avoided (including the Template property which should not be changed from its default value). Viewbox has been sealed to prevent the creation of derived classes that depend on these features not available on its WPF counterpart.

member.name: M:Intersoft.Client.UI.Controls.ViewboxInternal.MeasureOverride(System.Windows.Size)
member.summary: Measures the child element of a ViewboxInternal to prepare for arranging it during the ArrangeOverride pass.
member.remarks: ViewboxInternal measures it's child at an infinite constraint; it allows the child to be however large it so desires. The child's returned size will be used as it's natural size for scaling to Viewbox's size during Arrange.
member.param: An upper limit Size that should not be exceeded.
member.returns: The target Size of the element.

member.summary: Provides the behavior for the Arrange pass of Silverlight layout.
member.param: The final area within the parent that this object should use to arrange itself and its children.
member.returns: The actual size used once the element is arranged.

member.name: P:Intersoft.Client.UI.Controls.CallOut.PointerOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the offset position of the callout's pointer.
member.remarks: When pointer position is set to bottom / top, setting a negative value to pointer offset will shift the pointer to the left from its original position and vice versa. When pointer position is set to left / right, setting a negative value to pointer offset will shift the pointer to the right from its original position and vice versa.

member.name: P:Intersoft.Client.UI.Controls.CallOut.PointerPoint1
member.summary: Gets or set the first point that formed the pointer shape.
member.remarks: PointerPoint1, PointerPoint2, PointerPoint3 represent three points that will formed the shape of the pointer. It will draw the line from PointerPoint1 to PointerPoint2 and finally to PointerPoint3. Try to experiment with the values to get different kind of shapes.

member.name: P:Intersoft.Client.UI.Controls.CallOut.PointerPoint2
member.summary: Gets or set the second point that formed the pointer shape.
member.remarks: PointerPoint1, PointerPoint2, PointerPoint3 represent three points that will formed the shape of the pointer. It will draw the line from PointerPoint1 to PointerPoint2 and finally to PointerPoint3. Try to experiment with the values to get different kind of shapes.

member.name: P:Intersoft.Client.UI.Controls.CallOut.PointerPoint3
member.summary: Gets or set the third point that formed the pointer shape.
member.remarks: PointerPoint1, PointerPoint2, PointerPoint3 represent three points that will formed the shape of the pointer. It will draw the line from PointerPoint1 to PointerPoint2 and finally to PointerPoint3. Try to experiment with the values to get different kind of shapes.

member.name: P:Intersoft.Client.UI.Controls.CallOut.PointerPosition
